data.description: This playbook queries Active Directory for a list of users in the Administrators group and uses the results to update a Custom List. When the playbook is executed for the first time it will create a Generator asset that will automatically launch future executions once each hour.

cells.block_code:
def on_start(container):
    phantom.debug('on_start() called')
    
    # call 'check_for_generator' block
    check_for_generator(container=container)

    return
cells.title: START

cells.block_code:
def check_for_generator(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('check_for_generator() called')

    # collect data for 'check_for_generator' call

    parameters = []
    
    # build parameters list for 'check_for_generator' call
    parameters.append({
        'headers': "",
        'location': "/rest/asset?_filter_tags=[\"track_active_directory_admin_users\"]",
        'verify_certificate': False,
    })

    phantom.act("get data", parameters=parameters, assets=['http'], callback=extract_response_body, name="check_for_generator")

    return
cells.description: Check to see if there is already a Generator asset with the tag "track_active_directory_admin_users". This will be used to decide if a new Generator asset should be created.
cells.name: get data
cells.notes: Check to see if there is already a Generator asset with the tag "track_active_directory_admin_users". This will be used to decide if a new Generator asset should be created.
cells.title: Generic

cells.block_code:
def get_users_1(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('get_users_1() called')
    
    #phantom.debug('Action: {0} {1}'.format(action['name'], ('SUCCEEDED' if success else 'FAILED')))
    
    # collect data for 'get_users_1' call

    parameters = []
    
    # build parameters list for 'get_users_1' call
    parameters.append({
        'ph': "",
        'object_class': "group",
        'object_name': "Administrators",
        'all_users': False,
    })

    phantom.act("get users", parameters=parameters, assets=['domainctrl1'], callback=filter_1, name="get_users_1")

    return
cells.description: Get a list of all the users in the "Administrators" group in Active Directory, which includes "Domain Admins" and "Enterprise Admins" by default.
cells.name: get users
cells.notes: Get a list of all the users in the "Administrators" group in Active Directory, which includes "Domain Admins" and "Enterprise Admins" by default.
cells.title: Investigate

cells.block_code:
def filter_1(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('filter_1() called')

    # collect filtered artifact ids for 'if' condition 1
    matched_artifacts_1, matched_results_1 = phantom.condition(
        container=container,
        action_results=results,
        conditions=[
            ["get_users_1:action_result.data.*.samaccountname", "not in", "custom_list:Active Directory Administrators"],
        ],
        name="filter_1:condition_1")

    # call connected blocks if filtered artifacts or results
    if matched_artifacts_1 or matched_results_1:
        format_email(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle, filtered_artifacts=matched_artifacts_1, filtered_results=matched_results_1)

    return
cells.description: Ignore the returned SAM account names that are already in the custom list called "Active Directory Administrators".
cells.name: filter
cells.notes: Ignore the returned SAM account names that are already in the custom list called "Active Directory Administrators".

cells.block_code:
def update_custom_list(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('update_custom_list() called')

    filtered_results_data_1 = phantom.collect2(container=container, datapath=["filtered-data:filter_1:condition_1:get_users_1:action_result.data.*.samaccountname"])

    filtered_results_item_1_0 = [item[0] for item in filtered_results_data_1]

    phantom.add_list("Active Directory Administrators", filtered_results_item_1_0)

    return
cells.description: Add the newly detected users to the custom list called "Active Directory Administrators".
cells.name: add list
cells.notes: Add the newly detected users to the custom list called "Active Directory Administrators".
cells.title: API

cells.block_code:
def create_custom_list(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('create_custom_list() called')

    phantom.add_list("Active Directory Administrators", [])

    return
cells.description: Create the custom list called "Active Directory Administrators". This block should only be executed the first time this playbook is run.
cells.name: add list
cells.notes: Create the custom list called "Active Directory Administrators". This block should only be executed the first time this playbook is run.

cells.block_code:
def post_data_1(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('post_data_1() called')
    
    #phantom.debug('Action: {0} {1}'.format(action['name'], ('SUCCEEDED' if success else 'FAILED')))
    
    # collect data for 'post_data_1' call
    formatted_data_1 = phantom.get_format_data(name='format_4')

    parameters = []
    
    # build parameters list for 'post_data_1' call
    parameters.append({
        'location': "/rest/asset",
        'body': formatted_data_1,
        'headers': "",
        'verify_certificate': False,
    })

    phantom.act("post data", parameters=parameters, assets=['http'], name="post_data_1")    
    
    return
cells.custom_code:
def create_generator(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('create_generator() called')

    now_plus_minute = int(datetime.utcnow().strftime('%s')) + 60
    
    new_generator = {
        "description": "A cronjob-style Generator to kick off the track_active_directory_admin_users Playbook",
        "name": "track_active_directory_admin_users_generator",
        "product_name": "Generator",
        "product_vendor": "Generic",
        "type": "generic",
        "tags": ["track_active_directory_admin_users"],
        "configuration": {
            "create_containers": "1",
            "create_artifacts": "1",
            "artifact_count_override": True,
            "container_tag": "track_active_directory_admin_users",
            "randomize_container_status": False,
            "container_prefix": "Track Active Directory Admin Users",
            "max_cef_per_artifact": "0",
            "min_cef_per_artifact": "0",
            "ingest": {
                "interval_mins": "60",
                "poll": True,
                "container_label": "report",
                "start_time_epoch_utc": None
            }
        }
    }

    parameters = []
    
    # build parameters list for 'create_generator' call
    parameters.append({
        'location': "/rest/asset",
        'body': json.dumps(new_generator),
        'headers': "",
        'verify_certificate': False,
    })

    phantom.act("post data", parameters=parameters, assets=['http'], callback=create_custom_list, name="create_generator")    
    
    return
cells.description: Create a Generator asset by POSTing the desired configuration to the REST API of this Phantom instance. This block should only be executed the first time this playbook is run.
cells.name: post data
cells.notes: Create a Generator asset by POSTing the desired configuration to the REST API of this Phantom instance. This block should only be executed the first time this playbook is run.
cells.title: Generic

cells.block_code:
def format_email(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('format_email() called')
    
    template = """The Phantom playbook called track_active_directory_admin_users detected that the following new users were added to the Administrators group in Active Directory:
{0}"""

    # parameter list for template variable replacement
    parameters = [
        "filtered-data:filter_1:condition_1:get_users_1:action_result.data.*.samaccountname",
    ]

    phantom.format(container=container, template=template, parameters=parameters, name="format_email")

    send_email_1(container=container)

    return
cells.description: Format a message for an email listing the new Administrators that were detected.
cells.name: format
cells.notes: Format a message for an email listing the new Administrators that were detected.
cells.template:
The Phantom playbook called track_active_directory_admin_users detected that the following new users were added to the Administrators group in Active Directory:
{0}
cells.title: format

cells.block_code:
def send_email_1(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('send_email_1() called')
    
    #phantom.debug('Action: {0} {1}'.format(action['name'], ('SUCCEEDED' if success else 'FAILED')))
    
    # collect data for 'send_email_1' call
    formatted_data_1 = phantom.get_format_data(name='format_email')

    parameters = []
    
    # build parameters list for 'send_email_1' call
    parameters.append({
        'body': formatted_data_1,
        'to': "notifications@example.com",
        'from': "notifications@example.com",
        'attachments': "",
        'subject': "New Admin Users",
    })

    phantom.act("send email", parameters=parameters, assets=['smtp'], callback=update_custom_list, name="send_email_1")

    return
cells.description: Send an email to notify appropriate personnel of any new Administrators that were detected.
cells.name: send email
cells.notes: Send an email to notify appropriate personnel of any new Administrators that were detected.
cells.title: Generic

cells.block_code:
def decision_1(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('decision_1() called')

    # check for 'if' condition 1
    matched_artifacts_1, matched_results_1 = phantom.condition(
        container=container,
        action_results=results,
        conditions=[
            ["track_active_directory_admin_users", "in", "extract_response_body:formatted_data"],
        ])

    # call connected blocks if condition 1 matched
    if matched_artifacts_1 or matched_results_1:
        get_users_1(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle)
        return

    # call connected blocks for 'else' condition 2
    create_generator(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle)

    return
cells.description: Decide whether this is the first execution of this playbook, in which case a new Generator and Custom List will be created. If the Generator already exists the actual Active Directory query will be run.
cells.name: decision
cells.notes: Decide whether this is the first execution of this playbook, in which case a new Generator and Custom List will be created. If the Generator already exists the actual Active Directory query will be run.

cells.block_code:
def extract_response_body(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('extract_response_body() called')
    
    template = """{0}"""

    # parameter list for template variable replacement
    parameters = [
        "check_for_generator:action_result.data.*.response_body",
    ]

    phantom.format(container=container, template=template, parameters=parameters, name="extract_response_body")

    decision_1(container=container)

    return
cells.description: Convert the returned HTTP response body into a flat string that can be used directly in a decision.
cells.name: format
cells.notes: Convert the returned HTTP response body into a flat string that can be used directly in a decision.
cells.title: format

data.notes:
This playbook uses the following Apps:
 - HTTP (get data) [asset name = http] - this asset should be configured with the address and credentials of the REST API of this Phantom instance
 - Generator (ingest) [asset name = track_active_directory_admin_users_generator] - if this asset does not exist it will be created automatically the first time this playbook is run
 - LDAP (get users) [asset name = ldap] - this asset should be configured with the address and credentials of the domain controller to use for Active Directory queries. Version 1.2.30 or later is required so an app update may be necessary.
 - SMTP (send email) [asset name = smtp]

Deployment notes:
 - The Generator created and used by this playbook is similar to a cronjob. The configuration used in "create generator" causes it to create new empty containers with the label Report every 60 minutes. These values can be customized to the desired behavior. The goal of creating the asset within the playbook is to make the playbook self-configuring to some degree.
 - After the initial manual run the playbook should be set to Active.
 - The name of this playbook (track_active_directory_admin_users) is also used in the Generator asset name and the tag on that asset
 - The custom list called "Active Directory Administrators" is created by this playbook and updated when new Administrator group members are found
 - The email address notification@example.com is used as both the sender and receiver in "send email". These values should also be customized.
 - Note that other Active Directory groups could be easily added, such as Enterprise Admins, Domain Admins, or Schema Admins
